Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: sounds like i need to merge some more nspv changes into Hush, it's hard to keep up with y'all

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this bug was in libnspv

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c i assume hush is using an older version of libnspv that the internals use, but i don't pretend to know how it all works. haven't had time to go read all of that code

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: libnspv is for clients only

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: nothing to do with the nSPV fullnode

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or nSPV=1 clients

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: ok, so for instance, a GUI libnspv wallet running on a smart toaster is what actually uses libnspv. not smart chain full nodes or smart chain nodes running in nspv mode

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i thought the full node used libnspv as well, so i have already learned something

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
I found a problem with libnspv for Android (I'm adding support to have it as a so library for my kogs project).
There is a call to pthread_cancel() which is apparently absent in Android NDK.
@jl777c 
I can see that the loop in the work thread listens for NSPV_STOPRECEIVED flag. Maybe shutdown the thread also with setting this flag?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you know how to fix this, then please do and make a PR. i am not familiar with android pthread usage

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @dimxy i know very little about nspv

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but i have many scars of porting weird software across weird OS's

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @dimxy firstly, there should be a macro/etc that detects running under Android NDK, and run different code instead of `pthread_canel()` if true

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: then, if you know the proper way to do it on android, do it ðŸ™‚

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4610086/pthread-cancel-alternatives-in-android-ndk#4610138

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
yes, thank you, 
I'm testing the suggested fix for this

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: groovy. Android support is super awesome and important to have working well

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: I also found this article but seems in nspv there is a cleaner way to shutdown the thread, thank you

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: We agree that if I use the call rpc `spend` without `broadcast`  then I risk nothing? No funds are locked and the balance is not reduced?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: spend is purely local, cannot affect the blockchain.

Author: Slyris#2880
Content:
Okay thank you so much.

Now I have another question, for example I am in a video game, I have the sufficient number of gold to buy an item, I buy this item, visually I see immediately that my golds have been debited from my wallet. In the case of the blockchain we have to wait for the confirmation to be sure of the transaction, the feeling of play will not be skewed by the fact of seeing its sum debited later and receive his item only once the confirmed transaction?

(everything using nspv)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i cant speak top the gameplay aspect, but you should be able to mask over the fact it takes a minute to confirm

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: I can obviously visually immediately reduce the balance, it is not a problem but in case there has been a problem of transaction must be able to restore the state correctly.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as soon as it is pending, it is very very likely it will confirm, so it can be displayed as pending and then marked complete when confirmed. well, actually, until notarized, it isnt 100% permanent as it could get reorged, but that is unlikely

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: Ok so in game wallet visually will have 2 balance: Available, Pending ?

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: I think it's likely what we want to achieve

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think if you just display things based on pending or confirmed, the blockchain state will restore your gamestate?

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: Yeah i mean if in the wallet instead of 1000golds i see: 900 Rick 100 Pending

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you do need to make sure that if you assumed it was completed and it turns out it isnt, to undo whatever impact the orphaned tx had in the game

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: It's ok

Author: Slyris#2880
Content:
do we have an nspv call where we give the txid and it's telling us if it's pending or completed ?

I see https://docs.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/smart-chains/smart-chain-setup/nspv.html#mempool

But it's written `in development` means that's not finished yet ?

Author: Slyris#2880
Content: There is also `spentinfo` that i can use after the `broadcast`.

Author: Slyris#2880
Content:
i also see that: https://docs.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/smart-chains/smart-chain-setup/nspv.html#txproof

Is using a rpc call named `gettransaction` but it's not documented yet i think

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: mempool rpc works

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so you can scan for txid to be in mempool or not

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it isnt, you can check to see if it is confirmed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with txproof

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: for existing transaction it works super fast

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, it queries peers, if a response comes in, it returns. if not, it waits, but no response will arrive. maybe it is sending a "not found" response at the low level. someone can dig into this and make it respond faster for not found txid, but it seems in most cases the valid txid is queried
